For other Sportsmen named William Williams see William Williams
For other Sportsmen named Billy Williams see Billy WilliamsWilliam Henry "Buller" Williams (1873 – 9 January 1936) was a Welsh international rugby union forward who played club rugby for Pontymister RFC; and represented Wales. In 1900, Williams became a Triple Crown winning player when he represented Wales in all three of the games during the Home Nations Championship.

response: * William Henry Williams (rugby union) (1873–1936), Welsh rugby union footballer who played in the 1900s for Wales, Pontymister RFC, and London Welsh RFC
* William Henry Williams (1852–1941), English-born Australian headmaster and professor
William Henry Williams (7 November 1852 – 12 September 1941) was an English-born Australian Headmaster and Professor.
